entries.meaning: (now regional) A blow, especially on the face. [from 16th c.]

verbs.description: wherret (third-person singular simple present wherrets, present participle wherreting, simple past and past participle wherreted)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To hurry; to trouble; to tease.
examples: Find some other road; can't you; and don't keep wherreting me with your nonsense.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To box (somebody) on the ear; to strike on the ear.
